Original: Upon visiting the Echoing Library,
you are reunited with Logre.
[Page]
If you wish, you can invite Logre
into your guild.
Translation: Upon visiting the Echoing Library,
you are reunited with Logre.
[Page]
If you wish, you can invite Logre
into your guild.

Original: [Color:5]Invite Logre into your guild?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Invite Logre into your guild?[Color:0]

Original: [Color:3]Your guild is too full to register
a new member.[Color:0]
[Page]
[Color:3]If you would still like to register
Logre in your guild, make space for
him and return here.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]Your guild is too full to register
a new member.[Color:0]
[Page]
[Color:3]If you would still like to register
Logre in your guild, make space for
him and return here.[Color:0]

Original: [Color:3]Logre is now a registered member
of your guild.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]Logre is now a registered member
of your guild.[Color:0]

Original: [Color:3]If you wish to put Logre into your
party, go to the Explorers Guild
and select "Formation."[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]If you wish to put Logre into your
party, go to the Explorers Guild
and select "Formation."[Color:0]

Original: As you walk through the ancient
labyrinth, you find a large bookshelf
nestled in a dead end.
[Page]
You wonder if you have time to check
its contents, or if you should ignore
it and return to your explorations.
Translation: As you walk through the ancient
labyrinth, you find a large bookshelf
nestled in a dead end.
[Page]
You wonder if you have time to check
its contents, or if you should ignore
it and return to your explorations.

Original: A large bookshelf looms before you...
Translation: A large bookshelf looms before you...

Original: [Color:5]Check the bookshelf?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Check the bookshelf?[Color:0]

Original: Upon closer investigation, you find
a book that is still in good enough
condition to be read.
[Page]
You open it up and look inside...
[Page]
Letters in an unknown language dance
on the page... Irritated, you return
the book to the shelf.
Translation: Upon closer investigation, you find
a book that is still in good enough
condition to be read.
[Page]
You open it up and look inside...
[Page]
Letters in an unknown language dance
on the page... Irritated, you return
the book to the shelf.

Original: Upon closer investigation, you find
a book that is still in good enough
condition to be read.
[Page]
You open it up and look inside...
[Page]
The pages contain numerical formula
after formula... You sigh and return
the book to its place on the shelf.
Translation: Upon closer investigation, you find
a book that is still in good enough
condition to be read.
[Page]
You open it up and look inside...
[Page]
The pages contain numerical formula
after formula... You sigh and return
the book to its place on the shelf.

Original: Upon closer investigation, you find
a book that is still in good enough
condition to be read.
[Page]
You open it up and look inside...
[Page]
The book is filled with diagrams of
double helices. Dejected, you put
the book back where it came from.
Translation: Upon closer investigation, you find
a book that is still in good enough
condition to be read.
[Page]
You open it up and look inside...
[Page]
The book is filled with diagrams of
double helices. Dejected, you put
the book back where it came from.

Original: As you walk the oppressively silent
halls of the ancient labyrinth, you
see a fallen pillar in the corner.
[Page]
It looks to be just the right height
to sit down on for a rest.
Translation: As you walk the oppressively silent
halls of the ancient labyrinth, you
see a fallen pillar in the corner.
[Page]
It looks to be just the right height
to sit down on for a rest.

Original: There is a fallen pillar in the corner
of an open area...
[Page]
It looks to be just the right height
to sit down on for a rest.
Translation: There is a fallen pillar in the corner
of an open area...
[Page]
It looks to be just the right height
to sit down on for a rest.

Original: If you wish to rest here, despite the
potential threat of monsters, you are
free to do so.
Translation: If you wish to rest here, despite the
potential threat of monsters, you are
free to do so.

Original: [Color:5]Sit down on the pillar?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Sit down on the pillar?[Color:0]

Original: While you are mulling over whether or
not to rest, [Character:0] murmurs
something to you.
Translation: While you are mulling over whether or
not to rest, [Character:0] murmurs
something to you.

Original: [Character:0] says the scent of monsters
is in the air and that you should
leave this place immediately.
[Page]
You hate to ignore advice from a
trusted guildmate, but on the other
hand, you are very tired...
Translation: [Character:0] says the scent of monsters
is in the air and that you should
leave this place immediately.
[Page]
You hate to ignore advice from a
trusted guildmate, but on the other
hand, you are very tired...

Original: Just as you take off your packs and
sit down on the pillar, you hear
rustling from a nearby thicket!
[Page]
It seems the cruel labyrinth won't
allow you a moment's rest! Defend
yourself against the oncoming beasts!
Translation: Just as you take off your packs and
sit down on the pillar, you hear
rustling from a nearby thicket!
[Page]
It seems the cruel labyrinth won't
allow you a moment's rest! Defend
yourself against the oncoming beasts!

Original: With the monsters slain, you regret
ever thinking of resting here and
shamefacedly take your leave.
Translation: With the monsters slain, you regret
ever thinking of resting here and
shamefacedly take your leave.

Original: You regret not trusting the Sentinel's
sense of smell and shamefacedly take
your leave.
Translation: You regret not trusting the Sentinel's
sense of smell and shamefacedly take
your leave.

Original: It seems that [Character:0]'s senses
are detecting a faint scent of
monsters nearby.
[Page]
Forewarned is forearmed, and you may
be able to rest here even knowing
that monsters could attack...
Translation: It seems that [Character:0]'s senses
are detecting a faint scent of
monsters nearby.
[Page]
Forewarned is forearmed, and you may
be able to rest here even knowing
that monsters could attack...

Original: You set down your packs and decide to
take a rest.
[Page]
Here in this quiet corner of the maze,
you manage to forget your exhaustion
for a short while...
Translation: You set down your packs and decide to
take a rest.
[Page]
Here in this quiet corner of the maze,
you manage to forget your exhaustion
for a short while...

Original: But just as you are about to hop down
from the pillar, there comes rustling
from a nearby thicket!
[Page]
It seems that your extended rest
allowed monsters to close in on you!
You hastily draw your weapons!
Translation: But just as you are about to hop down
from the pillar, there comes rustling
from a nearby thicket!
[Page]
It seems that your extended rest
allowed monsters to close in on you!
You hastily draw your weapons!

Original: Thanks to your rest, you had a slight
advantage in the fray.
Translation: Thanks to your rest, you had a slight
advantage in the fray.

Original: You look to [Character:0], who says that
there is no scent of monsters in the
air and that it is safe to rest.
[Page]
Your aching muscles want to believe
that, but your anxious nerves wonder
if you should leave anyway...
Translation: You look to [Character:0], who says that
there is no scent of monsters in the
air and that it is safe to rest.
[Page]
Your aching muscles want to believe
that, but your anxious nerves wonder
if you should leave anyway...

Original: You set down your packs and decide to
take a rest.
[Page]
Here in this quiet corner of the maze,
you manage to forget your exhaustion
for a short while...
Translation: You set down your packs and decide to
take a rest.
[Page]
Here in this quiet corner of the maze,
you manage to forget your exhaustion
for a short while...

Original: Well satisfied with the rest, you
return to your journey with rested
bodies.
Translation: Well satisfied with the rest, you
return to your journey with rested
bodies.

Original: As you leave, [Character:0] gazes sadly
back at the pillar...
Translation: As you leave, [Character:0] gazes sadly
back at the pillar...

Original: Though a rest might calm your body,
you doubt it would do anything for
your mind, and you decide to leave.
Translation: Though a rest might calm your body,
you doubt it would do anything for
your mind, and you decide to leave.

Original: [Color:3]The party recovers 150 HP
and 40 TP.[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:3]The party recovers 150 HP
and 40 TP.[Color:0]

Original: Just as you begin your trek through
the Echoing Library, you hear a voice
call out to you.
Translation: Just as you begin your trek through
the Echoing Library, you hear a voice
call out to you.

Original: You turn and see a soldier who appears
to have been dispatched from Tharsis.
[Page]
"I hear tell that you've already been
through B1F of this place. In which
case I have a favor to ask...
[Page]
"There's supposedly a [Color:5]book concerning
numerical formulas[Color:0] here. Does that
ring a bell?
[Page]
You think back to see if you can
remember the book the soldier wants
so you can point him toward it.
Translation: You turn and see a soldier who appears
to have been dispatched from Tharsis.
[Page]
"I hear tell that you've already been
through B1F of this place. In which
case I have a favor to ask...
[Page]
"There's supposedly a [Color:5]book concerning
numerical formulas[Color:0] here. Does that
ring a bell?
[Page]
You think back to see if you can
remember the book the soldier wants
so you can point him toward it.

Original: [Color:5]Do you know where it is?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Do you know where it is?[Color:0]

Original: You recall seeing such a book while
exploring B1F previously. You tell
the soldier where to look for it.
Translation: You recall seeing such a book while
exploring B1F previously. You tell
the soldier where to look for it.

Original: "Aha... so that's where it is? Much
obliged, explorers.
[Page]
"I'll have a reward for you once I go
and get it." With that, the soldier
walks away.
Translation: "Aha... so that's where it is? Much
obliged, explorers.
[Page]
"I'll have a reward for you once I go
and get it." With that, the soldier
walks away.

Original: "Drat. Finding one book in this vast
library will be no small task... I'll
keep combing through the stacks here.
[Page]
"Sorry to have taken up your time,"
the soldier apologizes, and then
moves to the center of the hall.
Translation: "Drat. Finding one book in this vast
library will be no small task... I'll
keep combing through the stacks here.
[Page]
"Sorry to have taken up your time,"
the soldier apologizes, and then
moves to the center of the hall.

Original: You walk away in order to continue
your own search.
Translation: You walk away in order to continue
your own search.

Original: You again find the soldier who had
asked you about a book before, staring
at a map in the center of the hall.
[Page]
As you recall, he is searching for
a [Color:5]book of numerical formulas[Color:0]. If you
know of it, you may wish to share.
Translation: You again find the soldier who had
asked you about a book before, staring
at a map in the center of the hall.
[Page]
As you recall, he is searching for
a [Color:5]book of numerical formulas[Color:0]. If you
know of it, you may wish to share.

Original: [Color:5]Give him its location?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Give him its location?[Color:0]

Original: "Ah, it's you. I'm still at it, I'm
afraid... You wouldn't have found the
book I'm looking for, hmm?"
[Page]
You open up your map and tell the
soldier where the book can be found.
Translation: "Ah, it's you. I'm still at it, I'm
afraid... You wouldn't have found the
book I'm looking for, hmm?"
[Page]
You open up your map and tell the
soldier where the book can be found.

Original: "Ah, so you saw it here? I knew I
could count on the explorers of
the guild.
[Page]
"Thank you. I'll repay your kindness
once the book is in my hands." With
that, the soldier begins packing up.
Translation: "Ah, so you saw it here? I knew I
could count on the explorers of
the guild.
[Page]
"Thank you. I'll repay your kindness
once the book is in my hands." With
that, the soldier begins packing up.

Original: As you have no idea where the book is,
you leave the soldier to his maps and
walk away.
Translation: As you have no idea where the book is,
you leave the soldier to his maps and
walk away.

Original: You again find the soldier who had
asked you about a book before, staring
at a map in the center of the hall.
[Page]
He looks up from his map and notices
your presence.
Translation: You again find the soldier who had
asked you about a book before, staring
at a map in the center of the hall.
[Page]
He looks up from his map and notices
your presence.

Original: "Ah... Yes. You know, I looked where
you told me to, but I didn't find the
book I needed.
[Page]
The soldier narrows his eyes.
[Page]
"Are you positive that you know where
that [Color:5]book of numerical formulas[Color:0] is?"
Translation: "Ah... Yes. You know, I looked where
you told me to, but I didn't find the
book I needed.
[Page]
The soldier narrows his eyes.
[Page]
"Are you positive that you know where
that [Color:5]book of numerical formulas[Color:0] is?"

Original: "The location you gave me the other
day... The books I found there were
useless. Not at all what I needed."
[Page]
The soldier narrows his eyes. "Are
you positive that you know where
that [Color:5]book of numerical formulas[Color:0] is?"
Translation: "The location you gave me the other
day... The books I found there were
useless. Not at all what I needed."
[Page]
The soldier narrows his eyes. "Are
you positive that you know where
that [Color:5]book of numerical formulas[Color:0] is?"

Original: [Color:5]Do you truly know its location?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Do you truly know its location?[Color:0]

Original: You silently nod. "Then give me the
correct location this time," says
the soldier testily.
Translation: You silently nod. "Then give me the
correct location this time," says
the soldier testily.

Original: "Hmm... Your eyes seem honest enough.
I'll believe you one more time."
[Page]
The soldier nods curtly, pulls his
knapsack over his back, and goes down
into the depths of the maze.
Translation: "Hmm... Your eyes seem honest enough.
I'll believe you one more time."
[Page]
The soldier nods curtly, pulls his
knapsack over his back, and goes down
into the depths of the maze.

Original: "So... you didn't know. Then are you
saying you lied to me?
[Page]
"Never mind, I blame myself for being
too trusting. I'll overlook it this
once.
[Page]
"If you do happen to find out where
it is, I'll be here. Please come tell
me about it... the truth, this time."
[Page]
With that, the soldier returns to
poring over his map. You think it
wise to return to your own search.
Translation: "So... you didn't know. Then are you
saying you lied to me?
[Page]
"Never mind, I blame myself for being
too trusting. I'll overlook it this
once.
[Page]
"If you do happen to find out where
it is, I'll be here. Please come tell
me about it... the truth, this time."
[Page]
With that, the soldier returns to
poring over his map. You think it
wise to return to your own search.

Original: Just as you are about to embark on
your search, a voice calls out to
you, saying, "You there!"
Translation: Just as you are about to embark on
your search, a voice calls out to
you, saying, "You there!"

Original: Rushing over to you, out of breath,
is the Tharsis soldier whom you
helped in finding a book.
[Page]
"I've been looking for you! I was
waiting here to repay you for your
assistance the other day.
[Page]
"The book I needed was precisely
where you told me... Thanks to you,
my task is complete."
[Page]
The soldier cheerfully removes
something from his leather pouch.
"This is for you," he says.
Translation: Rushing over to you, out of breath,
is the Tharsis soldier whom you
helped in finding a book.
[Page]
"I've been looking for you! I was
waiting here to repay you for your
assistance the other day.
[Page]
"The book I needed was precisely
where you told me... Thanks to you,
my task is complete."
[Page]
The soldier cheerfully removes
something from his leather pouch.
"This is for you," he says.

Original: "I'd best be off, but I wish you the
best of luck in your explorations."
[Page]
With that, the soldier jogs off to
the skyship landing en route to the
city. You return to your search...
Translation: "I'd best be off, but I wish you the
best of luck in your explorations."
[Page]
With that, the soldier jogs off to
the skyship landing en route to the
city. You return to your search...

Original: As you walk the quiet ruins' halls,
you spy a pool of blood up ahead.
[Page]
When you approach it, you find a
crater in the ground with the corpse
of a crushed soldier inside.
[Page]
He must have fallen victim to one of
the roaming automatons with the iron
weights...
[Page]
You realize gravely that you are not
immune to the same fate, and vow to
be cautious in your travels.
Translation: As you walk the quiet ruins' halls,
you spy a pool of blood up ahead.
[Page]
When you approach it, you find a
crater in the ground with the corpse
of a crushed soldier inside.
[Page]
He must have fallen victim to one of
the roaming automatons with the iron
weights...
[Page]
You realize gravely that you are not
immune to the same fate, and vow to
be cautious in your travels.

Original: The instant the mechanical monsters
detect you, they begin sounding an
earsplitting klaxon.
Translation: The instant the mechanical monsters
detect you, they begin sounding an
earsplitting klaxon.

Original: Your stomach sinks as you sense more
enemies drawing near in response to
the sound!
[Page]
At this rate, you will face danger
from both sides... You must mind the
monsters drawing near to survive!
Translation: Your stomach sinks as you sense more
enemies drawing near in response to
the sound!
[Page]
At this rate, you will face danger
from both sides... You must mind the
monsters drawing near to survive!

Original: An earsplitting klaxon sounds
throughout the area!
Translation: An earsplitting klaxon sounds
throughout the area!
